newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Tuesday's Commission briefing.
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Tuesday's Commission briefing.

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Tuesday:

Spokesman Joao Vale de Almeida said there would be a briefing at 1515/1315 GMT in Brussels on the Commission's weekly meeting in Strasbourg, notably on the implementation of the Community's environment legislation.

Asked about the Commission's reaction to Denmark's announcement that it would block proposed EU action to counter Washington's anti-Cuba trade laws when foreign ministers meet in Luxembourg next week, spokesman Peter Guilford said the Commission would try to convince Denmark that the envisaged actions are within EU competence. Guilford also said other member states had needed to be convinced previously on this matter.
The Commission released the following documents:
- IP/96/943: The Commission's work programme for 1997.
- IP/96/945: Humanitarian aid in Africa: News in brief.
- IP/96/948: Cooperation with Russia in the field of navigation by satellite.
- Speech/96/260: Speech by Commission President Jacques Santer on the Commission's programme for 1997.
- Speech/96/261: Speech by Commissioner Franz Fischler on sustainable forest policy in Europe.
- Memo/96/99: European Commission action to safeguard and to enhance the value of the European cultural heritage, 1996.
- Report on implementation of the Commission's work programme for 1996.
- Western European Union, Council of ministers November 18 and 19, 1996, information to the press.
